result.execSummary:
The defendant Dean N Longo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dean N Longo

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Petitioner appeared, pro se.  Corporation Counsel in court by Jennifer Rhodes.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.
Hearing on petition of return of property proceeded.  Statements made by counsel and petitioner.  Court denies petition with prejudice; order signed and filed.

AFFIDAVIT OF SERVICE
CCW LICENSE
MILW CNTY SHERIFF DEPT INVENTORY LIST
Return of property hearing on September 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Milwaukee County Sheriff's Inventory # - NONE GIVEN
 
C.I.B. REFERENCE NO. 02218

Defendant Dean N Longo in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court ordered defendant to pay a FINE of $500.00 INCLUDING ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 08-05-2015 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.

Defendant Dean N Longo in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court grants defense motion for an adjournment of the plea/sentencing hearing.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dean N Longo in court with attorney Mark Pecora for Christopher Lee Hartley.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pretrial conference conducted.  Parties have reached a resolution.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dean N Longo in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for indigency hearing.  The defendant has retained counsel.  Defense has received discovery and requested a pretrial conference date in Branch 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dean N Longo in court.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  The defendant requested the Court appoint counsel.  Court questioned the defendant as to his income/monthly expenses.  Court ordered case adjourned to allow the defendant time to provide more information regarding his income/monthly expenses.  Court ordered case adjourned for continued indigency hearing in Branch 24.  Indigency hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No Weapons Order, signed and filed.  DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (3/4/15). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 04-12-2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Dean N Longo
Current: 145 Victoria Circle, Union Grove, WI 53182   (Effective: 03-03-2015)
Prior: 145 Victoria Circle, Union Grove, WI 53182

Defendant Dean N Longo in court.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 24.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3-3-2015 at 1:30pm
